Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water and light.
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a plant that is healthy and growing when it has enough water and light.
The student can draw a plant that looks unhealthy or is not growing when it does not have water.
The student can draw a plant that looks unhealthy or is not growing when it does not have light.
The student can include elements in the drawing that show the difference between plants with water and light and those without.
The student can use simple patterns, like sun and water droplets, to show how plants use light and water to live and grow.
